meanings.definition: To fail to keep or retain something properly.
meanings.sent1: I miskeep my keys often and then have trouble finding them.
meanings.sent2: Please do not miskeep your library books; return them on time.
meanings.sent3: I miskeep my umbrella so much that I should just buy a new one.
meanings.sent4: Her forgetfulness caused her to miskeep important documents, leading to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The careless student would always miskeep his homework, much to his teacher's frustration.

meanings.sent1: If you miskeep your phone, try calling it to locate it.
meanings.sent2: She tends to miskeep her sunglasses and then find them in odd places.
meanings.sent3: I miskeep my socks so often that I have a drawer just for mismatched ones.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to miskeep the coin, only to reveal it behind the volunteer's ear.
meanings.sent5: The explorer would often miskeep his map, causing delays in their journey.
